greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = floor(sigma(sigma(p))/p) = floor(sigma(p+1)/p) = floor(A008333(n)/p), where p is the n-th prime number.
comment: Values of these quotients are expectedly lower than ratios of A051027(n)/n.
example: For n = 7, the seventh prime is 17, so a(7) = floor(sigma(sigma(17))/17) = floor(sigma(18)/17) = floor(39/17) = 2.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 25 2004
